title: Registered Dental Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: It was an online recorded interview process. There was 4 questions asked with a minute timer to think about your response and 3 minutes timer to answer per question. You had three tries to record your answers.
Interview Questions: What is UT Health San Antonio's mission.

title: Physician Assistant, PA-C Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: After an initial phone interview, they asked me to come in for a 3-hour interview, basically an abbreviated oral boards. The person that I spoke to was very kind and her confidence in APPs was nice to hear.
Interview Questions: Is hospitalist medicine the only thing that you are interest in?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a recruiter about the position and was ultimately contacted by the hiring manager. Phone and video calls went well, the team was professional and easy to work with.
Interview Questions: Describe your process for performing a key function of the job description.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: First was a video interview with four questions that needed to be submitted then another interview over Microsoft teams with all of management. From when I first applied to when I received my offer letter it took about 2 months altogether.
Interview Questions: Can you briefly introduce yourself with your name your current position, and outline what interests you in the opportunity at UT Health SA.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The process took almost two months. At some point I thought that I was not selected but it was not the case. Their HR takes a while to get back but don't be discouraged. You can always write to the interviewers to ask your status.
Interview Questions: How fast should you answer emails? (no joke) How do you deal with difficult clients? What do you do if your project is behind schedule and over budget.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: It went very well! Short and sweet. There was great communication between the interviewer and the interviewee. I have not heard back yet, but it was still a great experience.
Interview Questions: What characterisitcs would help you do the best work?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had my first interview with one person, and my guess as long as I passed her standards, it was okay to bring in the team that this position worked with as well as the VP to participate in the final interview, total panel 8.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to admit to your supervisor or leadership that you made a mistake. What was the mistake you made and how did you correct it?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: They make you interview with a lot of different people and they take a long time to process through HR. Ut health doesn’t pay well either but it does have better benefits than most other places.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions but takes ages to hear back

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process was smooth. I had two interviews with 2 different doctors. I initially interviewed for Research Assistant and was recommended for the Research Coordinator position. Both interviews happened in the same week and I received the offer within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about skills and why am I interested in the position.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a virtual interview. The PI had reached out to me via email about scheduling the interview via MS Teams. It lasted a total of 30 minutes with the PI and one of his students.
Interview Questions: Any previous job experience. They described current projects and if I had any interest in working on those projects.

title: Internal Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: A ridiculous number of interviews (recruiter screening call, on-site 1:1 leadership interviews, on-site panel interview, peer phone interviews) plus assessments and projects. So many hoops to jump through, followed by weeks of ghosting. Finally, after I followed up with them again, I got a call from the department secretary to advise me that I was the runner-up candidate and they went with someone else.  It was very discouraging and disrespectrul.
Interview Questions: Hours of interviews = too many questions

title: Animal Attendant - Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and lay out their expectations of what kind of employee they are looking for. They are helpful when you have questions about the position and will be upfront with your compensation and how to progress.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about research as it pertains to animals?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was over zoom, he had his camera turned off. Asked about my experience. They care a lot about if you have phlebotomy experience since it’s a clinical research position. It was pretty relaxed.  Just be yourself and show interest.
Interview Questions:
Do you have phlebotomy experience?
Have you ever worked in a lab before?

title: MA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very straight to the point. interview was done through new virtual change. Felt just like a normal interview but in the comfort of your home. still required to dress up for interview due to they could still see you and your appearance
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself and your goals

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Most questions revolve around your interest in your field. Questions may also be asked about your academic history. Overall, not very difficult or prolonged, so no need to stress yourself about it.
Interview Questions: What interests you about pharmacy?

title: IT Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with the CMIO and then Skype with other directors.  They say after Skype interview in person would be conducted but they never got back to even provide feedback.
Interview Questions: Your experience.

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Very lengthy and slow process. It's a state job and it takes a while for the state to hire. It's a very long and intricate process. Very busy HR department.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current job?

title: Billing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief initial screening phone call with basic questions about my experience and what I have done for billing.  There was an personal interview at their office with a hiring manager only and no other staff members
Interview Questions: What was my experience in billing

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant and informative about the position available. Explained and answered questions regarding the position. We’re excited to have me On board. Pay is less then expected but can be negotiable.
Interview Questions: Ideal work day and hours

title: RN Clinical Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Breaking through HR was extremely difficult. Expect about a one-two month wait to hear from someone after you have submitting your online application. If you make it to the next level, good luck with more delays and chaos.
Interview Questions: What are your plans for higher education (PhD, DNP)?

title: Clinic Ops Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: met with manager and potential direct reports; initial phone interview and then came in to the office to interview with the team; long delay between interview and hearing back on status of interview
Interview Questions: How I would most benefit the organization

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Emailed my resume and cover letter, got an interview invitation,  got hired right after the interview! The interview process was very casual, they really want to get to know you, and what you would like to get out of this internship.
Interview Questions: Previous experience

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Very informative and interesting. Hope I get hired seems like a great company to work for.  They pay for health insurance, give you $100 allowance for scrubs and paid once a month.  Room for advancement
Interview Questions: Years of experience

title: Accounting Coordinator Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, both in-person. The first was with a panel, the 2nd was with the director of accounting. They were both fairly easy interviews. Took about 2 weeks after the final interview to get an offer
Interview Questions: Do you work better as a team or individually?

title: Admin Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: A long time to call after applying, phone interview before in person.  In person interview took a long time and included a lot of them complaining about former co-workers.    Felt the negative vibe at the reception desk which continued during interview.
Interview Questions: How will you get along with others?

title: Student Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions:
I was referred by a friend who was already interning at UT Health San Antonio. 
I was scheduled for an interview via phone call & was asked to email an updated resume prior to the interview. I was never asked to fill out any sort of application.

The interview itself went pretty smoothly. It was between 30-45 minutes. 
I interviewed first with the department director, a senior level data analyst second, and the direct hiring manager last.

All three sessions were traditional interviews rather than technical skill set interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself & your work experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: They were super nice and made me feel very comfortable. They talked to me about their research and how long they had been working together. Then they asked me a few questions but it was a very nice interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your past undergraduate research?

title: Quality Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was a group interview which would usually make me nervous but, the interviewers who are part of the team made the process more smooth and less intimidating. They asked questions from a list.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between leading and managing?

title: Senior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was swift and efficient. I had a phone interview prior to actually meeting for an in person interview. I met with several people, including the person who would be my boss, a coworker, a collaborator, and the person who is leaving the position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (Houston, TX) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went on one interview and it was with the director. Make sure what is the job require and make sure you have the background for it. Peoplesoft expeeince is always a plus
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Office Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I read everybody's review about UTHSCSA's interview, and it looked like it should be a piece of cake. However, I was totally lost during the interview. Half of the questions are job related, which I have never done before. The other half are regular interview questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself after 5 yrs?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I attended one of the PI's lab meetings. I introduced myself and talked about my research interests. I was hired after the lab meeting. The interview process was pretty simple.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to conduct research here?

title: Research Area Specialist Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online at the uthscsajobs site and within a week was called and was offered an interview for the next day.  I accepted and interview was pretty standard and everyone was friendly.  Soon after the interview I was asked to fill out a background check form which is given for all applicants who passed the initial screening process but does not mean you have been hired.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for me?

title: Director Clinical Safety Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very vague. I had no idea what the interviewer thought. There were no specific questions and the interview did not follow any type of pattern. I was asked about my military experience but nothing that was directly related to the position
Interview Questions: What was my experience

title: Administrative Assistant Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview went very well. Was asked the basic questions for the position and explained my skills that I could bring the team that would help pick up where is was left off.  Unfortunately someone else more suited for the job was picked.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself?

title: Research Area Specialist Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. After applying for the position on UTHSCSA's website, I received word for an in-person interview. The interview was with 2 people and the questions were very standard. After the interview, I was notified that I was selected for the position and it took about 4 weeks until I was able to start working there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company?

title: Research Area Specialist Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Nearly a month after applying for the position, I received a phone call to do a phone interview.  Then about a week later, I received a call to come in for an in person interview.  This first interview was with two higher level management personnel.  A couple days later, I received a call to come in for a group interview with the research team members.  After that I was told by the department manager they were planning on hiring me and were getting paperwork sent to HR.
Interview Questions:
Are you organized/detail oriented?
Tell me about your experience?
How are you working with others?
What are your strengths/weaknesses?

title: Research Area Specialist Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal meeting with 2 staff members who were thorough, engaging and congenial. It was a pleasure to meet with both of them and I appreciated the disarming tone to the meeting.
Interview Questions:
What did I love or hate about my last position? 
Using a past experience, how did I succeed in the face of adversity?

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 3 people.  One being the medical director. It went very well. Interview lasted about 1 hour.  I thought I landed the job.  Especially when they asked me to sign forms to do a background check.  But apparently they do background checks on their finalists. Never had that happen to me before.
Interview Questions: All about my career in the medical field. And if I can multitask. They gave me scenarios.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview with department manager, and one staff MD in which they gave basic information the company, and more detailed information about the position, and duties of the position, discussed hours of the job, responsibilities of the job. Interview wrap up was done with questions that I had regarding the position. The entire interview was about 30 minutes in total.The background check took about two weeks. Total time from first call for interview to start day was 2 and a half weeks. The entire Interview process was smooth.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.  Basic question, tell us about yourself, why do you want to work with us, what are your weak and strong points, do you like working alone or as a team.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: Within a month after submitting an application, I have gotten a call back from the employer and we scheduled for an interview. At an interview, I was asked about my educational background and research experience. It was very friendly and informative.
Interview Questions: What would you like to gain from this job.

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions:
- Received an email directly from the Hiring Manager
1-1 w/t hiring manager
Interview Questions: Very basic- situational

title: Biller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: First i applied for the position online and about 2 weeks later I get a call from someone at UTHSC and she did a phone interview a couple of days later I was contacted for a face to face interview. I arrived about 20 minutes early and the hr rep was about 15 minutes late the interview was with a panel of people and they asked questions like tell me about yourself and if you were a hiring for the position what would you look for in an employee. The interview went pretty good but its been a week now and I havent heard anything.
Interview Questions: If i were to call your previous employer what would they say you need help with?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: 3 person panel, 45 minute interview. Straight forward. The usual questions regarding previous work experience ect. The panel asked different questions pertaining to my  previous jobs and current qualifications for the job I was seeking employment,
Interview Questions: They asked a lot regarding my previous experience managing student life activities and my previous program coordinator jobs.

title: Business Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio
Interview Descriptions: I had five interviews overall spanning four months. At the end of my last interview I was told that things had gone very well and they would be making a decision that day. Four mounths passed, my phone calls were not returned, my requests for feedback were ignored. UNPROFESSIONAL!
Interview Questions: "Tell me about yourself."

title: Systems Administrator - Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed in the Dean of Medicine's office in 2012. The position was attractive because it seemed challenging and in a high-profile area of the organization. I interviewed once by phone and then twice in person. Made it to the final round (2 candidates) interviewed. In the end, I waited more than a month until I finally received a rejection email.
Interview Questions: "You are clearly overqualified for this position. Why do you want the job?" I had outlined my career track, goals, skills, knowledge and experience in the cover letter. This was my dream job and I had targeted it. The interviewer (an Assistant Dean) commented that she felt she would be unable to confidently direct me in my duties... how do you show self-credibility and be demure at the same time???

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions:
telephone interview and asked a lot of questions. From the previous experience to work ethics.
Some of the questions are weird and I did not expected. But overall it was good and I got a chance to visit the lab and give a presentation of what I was doing for my PhD work. and it turned out to be good
Interview Questions: Give me five reasons I should take you. and five reasons I should not

title: POST DOCRTORAL FELLOW Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Following email application and introduction, telephone interview for about 30-50 mins on research experience, salaries and visa requirements.  I was asked about my future plans and where I see myself down the lane.  What I expect to get at the end of my tenure
Interview Questions: What is your visa status and requirements?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initially there was one interview with direct supervisor. Then there was a second interview with the Department Chairman and with some of the office staff. I was given some background reading materials and policies and procedures to review. Once I was hired, I had to complete a 3 day employee orientation class.
Interview Questions: Have I worked with peoplesoft in the past.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Uthscsajobs.com, got called in by the PI's secretary who briefly described the available position. Was interviewed by two of the researchers. Interview was brief and low key. Got a call back with an offer approx. 1.5 weeks later.
Interview Questions: How flexible would I be with scheduling, as the nature of their research sometimes required off hours.

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UT Health San Antonio (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
long process, no outstanding points out of the ordinary
everyone was professional and courteous
back office staff were friendly
each person could be helpful and chose to be
office was clean and tidy
no questions out of the ordinary
i recommend them to anyone
Docs were all kind and conversational
Interview Questions: typical questions about management
